column4: can I install ubuntu-restricted-extras if I live in United States?
can you? yes.. is it legal? that's up for debate

there's a couple of ways of doing "portable" ubuntu.. they way you mentioned by running it from a usb stick in a window in Windows (emulation) and booting directly to a usb stick regardless of the os on the computer.

running any os directly from a usb stick is typically slower then a direct install.. also if  you want to try ubuntu without getting rid of your widows install, you can run the live cd. or install virtualbox or do a dual boot
